availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ferdinand D. Rigney (Adair Co, Ky, farmer and major (U.S.A.))

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Perlina Rigney. Farmer in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a major from December 28, 1863, to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, p. 13.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 352.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 944.
"Ferdinand D. Rigney (1821-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial #81058224, accessed January 17, 2020, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81058224.
